By Infernus on Wednesday, July 21, 2004 - 10:10 pm:

Some documents do not cause reading material to appear in the library. As well, it would be difficult to determine which of the starting documents gives you what starting reading material.

So, basically, i'm saying that you shouldn't plan on documenting numbers too, only a bit of a "heads up" if you had that in mind.

By Con on Sunday, July 25, 2004 - 02:04 pm:

Hmm, I'm not exactly sure how to write these up, but...

History

3 Ancient Deities
(Page 1)
The 3 famous gods,
Fleria, Gadamon, and
Bragma are worshipped
by people across the
land.
Images are found in
shrines everywhere.
(Page 2)
But there is a little-
known fact about two
of these gods:
Gaderman and Phrelia.
(Page 3)
When these two were
young, they bickered
about everything, and
caused people around
them much trouble.

Ancient Technology
(Page 1)
Legend has it that
in ancient times
people used special
methods to strengthen
monsters.
(Page 2)
But the technology
used was greatly
harmful to the minds
and bodies of the
monsters - eventually
causing them
to go mad.
(Page 3)
This created a series
of tragedies, until
finally the technology
itself was sealed
away for good.

Cox's File 1
(Page 1)
A long time ago,
the people in charge
of monster training
and regeneration were
called Tochika.
(Page 2)
Fleria and Gadamon,
who appear in the
myths, were probably
two of the Tochika.
=P.J. Cox=


That's all I have for History, I'll probably type the next section up later.

By Con on Sunday, July 25, 2004 - 02:30 pm:

Monster

Monster Mysteries
(Page 1)
The regeneration of
monsters is a recent
phenomenon, but
monsters themselves
have existed from
long ago.
(Page 2)
However, nobody knows
why they were sealed
in Saucer Stones, or
when they dissapeared.

[Origins]
(Page 1)
Monsters that appear
the same sometimes
take slightly
different forms,
depending on their
area of origin.
(Page 2)
For example, take a
Tsunomaru, a monster
born from the
combination of a Suezo
and Tiger.
Depending on where
the Saucer Stone was
found, and other
(Page 3)
differences leading
up to it's birth,
the Tsunomaru may be
born with or without
horns.
(Page 4)
It is not known whether
this is a factor
determined by regional
differences, or by a
difference in the
Saucer Stone itself.

About the Suezo
(Page 1)
Since ancient times,
people have had
trouble raising
the moody Suezo.
(Page 2)
There are tales of
Suezo skipping
training, or being
put in charge of the
shop, only to eat
the items.
(Page 3)
Of course, most
people are not silly
enough to put Suezo
in charge of a shop
in the first place.

About the Pixie
(Page 1)
Cute, but fickle.
Lovable, but bratty.
Perhaps this
description reminds
you of the trickiest
of monsters, the Pixies.
(Page 2)
In every age, there
have been breeders
who were tricked by
the mischievous
Pixies.
(Page 3)
In some rare cases,
with the most
beautiful Pixies,
wars were waged with
them as the cause.
(Page 4)
We are unlikely to
see any more such
wars, but there have
always been breeders
raising pixies.
And we will likely
see more for
generations eternal.

By King952 on Monday, July 26, 2004 - 09:16 am:

History

Cox's File 2
(page 1)
Eventually, the
Tochika shared their
monster training
skills with the
general population
(page 2)
For this they were
revered by many
people, and this
likely explains
why they were
worshipped as deities
in late generations.
=P.J. Cox=

Cox's File 3
(page 1)
There is a blank
period of history in
this world.
It is the period
between when the
Tochicka spread their
monster knowledge,
(page 2)
and today's age.
During this period,
the technology for
regenerating
monsters from Saucer
Stones, as well as the
monster themselves,
(page 3)
where lost. But nobody
know why.
=P.J. Cox=

Cox's File 5
(page 1)
Kawrea Volcano:
This special location
is believed to be the
location whre the
Phoenix dies and
is reborn.
(page 2)
Legend has it that
long ago, the Phoenix
fought an evil beast,
saving the world.
The Phoenix is
a special type of
monster.
(page 3)
No matter who or what
tries to stop the
flutter of the
Phoenix's wings,
it will alwyas
continue flying.
=P.J. Cox=

By King952 on Monday, July 26, 2004 - 09:18 am:

Monster

Monster Mysteries
(page 1)
The regeneration of
monsters is a recent
phenomenon, but
monsters themselves
hae existed from
long ago.
(page 2)
However, nobody knows
why they were sealed
in Saucer Stones, or
when they disappeared.

About the Ducken
(page 1)
The Ducken is
considered one of
the most mysterious
monsters of ancient
civilization.
Little is known
about its creation.
(page 2)
Ancient people, at
one point, became
unable to create the
Ducken, and had to
rely on regeneration
from Saucer Stones.
(page 3)
As a result, details
about the Ducken,
such as where, when,
or why it was created
are not known.
(page 4)
Some theories say
that is was merely a
toy create by
ancient people
(page 5)
other theories argue
that it was a doll
that became imbued
with a mystical power,
like the Mew.

About the Golem
(page 1)
There are records of
Golems going back to
the age of myths.
Humans have been
familiar with the
Golems for a long time.
(page 2)
Even in the myths
they are knowns as
good-natured monsters,
usually depicted as
strong monsters with
kind hearts.
(page 3)
Sadly, due to their good nature, they
usually only play
sideline roles in the
stories.
Of course, I supposed
that, too, is fitting
of the Golem though.

By King952 on Monday, July 26, 2004 - 09:19 am:

Land/Climate

The Elives School
(page 1)
A number of years back
FIMBA and IMa worked
in cooperation to
create a breeder school
called Elives School.
(page 2)
The school attracted
talented young boys
and girls, who, after
graduation, joined
one of the two groupds,
FIMBA or IMa starting
with official
Breeder Rank E.

Vizley's Monster
(page 1)
Vizley is known for
its long monster
lifespan. Currently,
people are
investigating whether
this is because of
the warm and
comfortable climate,
(page 2)
or a result of
generating a monster
in this town.

By GM on Friday, February 6, 2009 - 05:43 pm:

This one's been a long time coming:

Land/Climate

Regarding IMa
(Page 1)
IMa was created with the FIMBA model in mind. IMa has been concentrating its efforts on monster battles,
(Page 2)
and as a result, make use of grueling Training Gadgets to strengthen their monsters more extensively than other organizations.
(Page 3)
Some monsters, unable to bear the relentless training, run away. In recent years, the increase in stray monsters has developed into a serious problem.
